discourse_list.title: Fixing the par value of the stablecoins

content.content: I wrote an article following my comment on the FEI PSM proposal.   Medium – 30 Sep 21    How to fix the par value of stablecoins In the real world, a one-dollar bill has the same value as $1 at your Citigroup account or $1 at DBS Bank in Indonesia. You can go from one…  Reading time: 4 min read       In short, it’s about setting tin/tout of the PSM to 0% (at least one) in order to achieve a 1:1 peg. From there, other stablecoin protocols will be able to provide a PSM-like facility to get this 1:1 feature as well (without having to deal with centralized stablecoins directly). By hoarding DAI to help their liquidity and peg, we obviously get more capital to work with. I reckon this is not super helpful now as we have 60% of stablecoins already, but I’m confident this will not last long. The aim is to have $1 = 1 USDC = 1 USDP = 1 DAI = 1 FEI = 1 FRAX = …I think it’s important if we want DeFi to become mainstream and it will be important for RWA as well (where 1bps lost might be too much). What do you think?
